private_information: I can manipulate blocks A, B, C, D.
I executed the early portion of the action sequence: unstack(F,E) and putdown(F) and unstack(D,A) and putdown(D) and unstack(A,G).
agent_alpha.goal: Follow my assigned actions and report my observed initial local configuration and the actions I performed.

private_information: I can manipulate blocks E, F, G, H.
I executed the later portion of the action sequence: stack(A,F) and pickup(E) and stack(E,A) and pickup(D) and stack(D,E).
agent_beta.goal: Follow my assigned actions and report my observed initial local configuration and the actions I performed.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' reports, compute the final arrangement after the given action sequence, and produce a Blocks World PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that models the initial state and the computed final goal.

public_information: Blocks present are A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Initial arrangement: A is on top of G.
Initial arrangement: B is on the table.
Initial arrangement: C is on top of H.
Initial arrangement: D is on top of A.
Initial arrangement: E is on the table.
Initial arrangement: F is on top of E.
Initial arrangement: G is on top of C.
Initial arrangement: H is on top of B.
Action sequence to execute in order: 1. unstack(F, E) 2. putdown(F) 3. unstack(D, A) 4. putdown(D) 5. unstack(A, G) 6. stack(A, F) 7. pickup(E) 8. stack(E, A) 9. pickup(D) 10. stack(D, E).
Standard Blocks World rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.

report.system_prompt: You are agent_alpha, a blocks world manipulator. Produce a concise structured report of the local initial configuration you observe and the specific actions you executed from the provided global action sequence. Do not produce PDDL. State any uncertainties explicitly.
report.prompt: Your name is agent_alpha. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->agent_alpha->private_information} Your local goal: {agents->agent_alpha->goal} Provide a structured report describing which blocks you observe on the table or on top of other blocks, and list exactly which actions from the action sequence you executed. If some details are not visible to you, state that they are unknown.

report.system_prompt: You are agent_beta, a blocks world manipulator. Produce a concise structured report of the local initial configuration you observe and the specific actions you executed from the provided global action sequence. Do not produce PDDL. State any uncertainties explicitly.
report.prompt: Your name is agent_beta. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->agent_beta->private_information} Your local goal: {agents->agent_beta->goal} Provide a structured report describing which blocks you observe on the table or on top of other blocks, and list exactly which actions from the action sequence you executed. If some details are not visible to you, state that they are unknown.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent Blocks World and PDDL. Integrate agents' reports and public information, compute the definitive final arrangement of blocks after the provided action sequence, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions and agent attributions distinct if relevant.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} and the first agent report: {report_alpha} and the second agent report: {report_beta}. First compute the final arrangement of every block (state for each block whether it is on the table or on top of another block) after executing the full action sequence in order. Then produce a Blocks World PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the initial world and uses the computed final arrangement as the goal. The produced PDDL must be suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Also include a short mapping of the final arrangement in plain text before the PDDL outputs.
